Key Match Events: The Cleveland Cavaliers rallied to beat the Brooklyn Nets 105-100.
The Cavaliers extended their season-opening win streak to 11 games.
Cleveland trailed by 10 points heading into the final quarter and overcame a 13-point deficit early in the fourth quarter.
Post-Match Reflections: Kenny Atkinson admitted that the win streak is becoming a source of motivation and making the games feel more high-stakes.
Darius Garland acknowledged the streak is in the back of his mind and emphasized the team's focus on the bigger picture of winning a championship.
